verses.kjv: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.
verses.ct: So if you have been raised to new life with Christ, pursue the things of heaven, where Christ is seated at God's right hand.

verses.kjv: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.ct: Focus your minds on heavenly things, not on earthly ones.

verses.kjv: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.
verses.ct: Because you have died to your old selves, and your true life is now hidden with Christ in God.

verses.kjv: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.
verses.ct: When Christ, who is our life, is revealed, then you will also be revealed with him in glory.

verses.kjv: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth; fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness, which is idolatry:
verses.ct: So put to death whatever belongs to your earthly nature: sexual immorality, impurity, uncontrolled passion, evil desires, and greed — which is the same as idolatry.

verses.kjv: For which things’ sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:
verses.ct: God's wrath is coming on those who are disobedient because of these very things.

verses.kjv: In the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.
verses.ct: You yourselves used to practice these things when your lives were defined by them.

verses.kjv: But now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.ct: But now you must get rid of all of them: anger, rage, hatred, slander, and obscene language from your mouth.

verses.kjv: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;
verses.ct: Don't lie to each other, since you have stripped off your old self along with its habits.

verses.kjv: And have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of him that created him:
verses.ct: You have clothed yourselves with the new self, which is being continually reshaped in knowledge to reflect the image of the one who created it.

verses.kjv: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free: but Christ is all, and in all.
verses.ct: In this new identity, there is no distinction between Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, foreigner, barbarian, slave, or free person. Instead, Christ is everything, and he is in everyone.

verses.kjv: Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering;
verses.ct: Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and deeply loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.

verses.kjv: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.ct: Bear with each other and forgive one another whenever someone has a complaint against another person. Just as Christ forgave you, you must also forgive.

verses.kjv: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.
verses.ct: On top of all these qualities, put on love, which ties everything together in perfect unity.

verses.kjv: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
verses.ct: Let the peace of God direct your hearts, since you were called into one body for this very purpose. And be thankful.

verses.kjv: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom; teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verses.ct: Let Christ's message live in you abundantly, with complete wisdom. Teach and counsel each other through psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing with gratitude in your hearts to the Lord.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.ct: Whatever you do, whether in speech or action, do it all representing the Lord Jesus, offering thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.kjv: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.
verses.ct: Wives, place yourselves under the guidance of your husbands, as is appropriate for those who follow the Lord.

verses.kjv: Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.
verses.ct: Husbands, love your wives and never treat them harshly.

verses.kjv: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
verses.ct: Children, obey your parents in everything, because this is pleasing to the Lord.

verses.kjv: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.
verses.ct: Fathers, don't constantly criticize your children, or they will become discouraged.

verses.kjv: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God:
verses.ct: Workers, obey your earthly masters in everything — not just performing when they're watching to win their approval, but with sincere devotion, out of deep reverence for God.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.ct: Whatever task you take on, pour your whole heart into it, as though you are working for the Lord rather than for people.

verses.kjv: Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.ct: Remember that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.

verses.kjv: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.
verses.ct: But anyone who does wrong will be repaid for that wrong, because God shows no favoritism.
